page.title: 06Sheerness Historical Links
page.content: Sheerness has 3 main areas, Blue Town (which supposedly gets its name from the amount of blue paint which found its way out of the dockyard), Mile Town and Marine{Town,}which stretches along the sea-front east of the dockyard. The road names of Marine Town give clues to the period it was built and are a reminder of Sheerness's links with the{armed forces. Names of roads such as Wellesley; Alma and Vincent have famous origins and the{public houses,}Heights of Alma; Hero of Crimea and The Napier are familiar names in history. The Victoria, a feature of the{landscape and known locally as the Glasshouse because of its many windows, is named after the Queen who ruled throughout Marine Town's development.
